alert.note: Alert for Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 23 at 2:31AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Windham and western Kent Counties through 315 AM EDT... At 231 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Griswold, or near Jewett City, moving north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coventry, Plainfield, Killingly, Southbridge, Putnam, Thompson, Brooklyn, Woodstock, Canterbury, Pomfret and Sterling. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
